bibl.title: Aristotle and Menander on How People Go Wrong.
bibl.note: The articles considers Aristotle's and Menander's presentation of emotions and of the way that emotions are involved in ethical choice, as an example of how both authors shared ideas about human nature and psychology. The first part focuses on the actions and reactions of two characters of Menander's Samia: Moschion and Demeas.
